description.p: Marksmans’ impeccable aim make them invaluable on the battlefield, where they can pick off vital targets. They are famous for both accuracy and showmanship. Sharpshooting holds a long history of competition and fame; skilled snipers often surpass great warriors.

When you take this archetype at 3rd level, you exceed a common archer or triggerman and enter the realm of entertainment. You learn two of the following Trickshots, and an additional one when you reach 10th and 15th level in this class. You can only use Trickshots with ranged attacks made with ranged or thrown weapons. You can only use one Trickshot per attack roll, and cannot use Trickshots on attack rolls already affected by or granted by another Trickshot.

Barrage. You can use your action to make a ranged attack against any number of creatures within 5 feet of a point you can see within your weapon’s range. You must have ammunition or thrown weapons for each target, as normal, and you make a separate attack roll for each target.

Double Up. You can expend two weapons or pieces of identical ammunition instead of one on an attack, which deals an additional damage die if it hits. The close and long ranges of this attack are halved.
Hairtrigger. When you have advantage on an attack roll against a target, you can forgo the advantage for that roll to make an additional attack against the same target as a bonus action.
Heavy Impact. When you hit a Huge or smaller creature with an attack you can push them 5 feet away from you.

Richochet. When you hit a creature with a weapon attack you can make a second attack against another creature within 30 feet of the original target, using the same piece of ammunition. The second attack’s damage is halved.

description.p: Also at 3rd level, you can rally your allies with your displays of incredible skill. When you use a Trickshot, you can grant up to 6 creatures that can see and hear you temporary hit points equal to half your fighter level. You have 3 uses of this feature, and regain all uses of this feature when you finish a short or long rest, and when you damage a hostile creature benefitting from 1/2 or 3/4 cover, you regain one use of this feature.

description.p: At 7th level, when you land a critical hit with a ranged attack, you can use a bonus action to give an ally within 30 feet that can see and hear you advantage on the next ability check or saving throw they make within the next minute. You also gain proficiency in Performance.

description.p: Starting at 10th level, you choose one of the following styles to further distinguish yourself.

Close Quarters. Ranged attacks you make against a target within 5 feet of you aren’t made with disadvantage, and you can use your ranged weapons, bolts, and arrows as melee weapons that you are proficient in. Weapons deal 1d8 bludgeoning damage. Arrows and bolts are light and finesse, and deal 1d4 piercing damage.

Sniper. The standard and long ranges of your weapons increase by 15 feet, you can Search as a bonus action, and if you haven’t moved you can expend all your movement to gain advantage on the first ranged attack you make on your turn.
Quickdraw. You add your proficiency bonus to initiative rolls. When you roll initiative, you can make a single ranged attack.
